39489112.review:
RiME одна из тех игр, которые можно отнести к категории "Лучше любых ожиданий". Игру делали долго и качественно. Сразу видны и источники вдохновения, первое это конечно Journey, но тут много всего (Ico, The Legend of Zelda, работы Миядзаки). В одном моменте я даже увидел прямой референс на Limbo. Все что связано с визуальной частью и музыкой просто потрясающе, проделана поистине колоссальная работа. Не знаю во сколько обошелся production, но после такого сразу отпадают вопросы о, как мне казалось, немного завышенном ценнике на игру. Геймплей относительно простой, состоит в решение несложных пазлов и эксплоринге уровня на поиск разных (необязательных для сбора) вещей. Карабкаться по уступам, бегать, прыгать и плавать придется много. Пазлы кстати сделаны очень креативно и красиво. Игра местами трогает, здесь очень милые сцены, а концовка уж точно заставит пустить слезу более менее чувственного человека. После прохождения таких игр как RiME у меня на душе всегда остается что-то теплое. Возможно гордость за таких людей как TequilaWorks, которые дарят нам маленькие шедевры и надежда, что в индустрии дела все еще идут хорошо.

Из проблем стоит отметить плохую оптимизацию, в игре часто проседает FPS в определенных местах, независимо от того насколько мощная у вас видеокарта. А вот багов не было замечено ни одного.

Определенно, одна из лучших игр прошлого года. Если вам нравятся такие игры как Journey, ABZU рекомендую к прохождению.

39479336.review:
[h1]Spoiler free review, with a short and longer version:[/h1]

I got this game as a Xmas' gift from a friend. Let's roll:

[b]TLDR version[/b]

buy this game if:

+ you love games that visually and emotionally are able to stimulate 
+ you like story driven games with a [u]side puzzle component[/u]
+ you fancy games that show different scenarios and setups quite often

don't buy this game if:

- you don't have a "decent" / above "mid-tier" pc
- you believe that spending 40$ on a 5 hour game might be too much
- you love games heavily based on puzzles

Verdict 8/10, well done, deep (expensive too) and meaningful gaming experience 
Time required to complete the main game : 5 hours
Time required to 100% the game: 8-10 hours 

Detailed version

A quick summary of the most important subjects:

1- [b]The price tag[/b] can be discouraging and intimidating. The game hasn't any replayability value: replaying the story chapters will only grant you the chance to grab those collectibles you'll be needing for the real ending. Now... im not a business or budgeting manager, so i don't know why this price tag has been decided. I'm not saying that this game doesn't deserve its money, just keep in mind that for 40$ you can get many good indie titles at the same time rather then getting only this gorgeous, deep and terrific looking one that will last for 5 hours.

2- [b] The pacing and story telling is extremely well structured [/b] as the game will start off with a sunny seaside landscapes, ruled by a peaceful environment and will keep changing throughout the whole game by switching themes, songs, themes, enemies and situations, while being able to be and seem fresh and never repetitive through the whole experience, which will be heavily puzzle based at the start and will get more and more platforming centered after.

3- [b] Frame drops aside, the game is really polished and meaningful [/b] as shown here:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1275327542

just to give you an example, when the young protagonist has to climb a slope, has to lean, sit down or just performing physical activity...is realistic as his moves are properly represented, you will his see his legs moving accordingly and his whole body reacting naturally. Many puzzles and rooms are based on the game and story dignity and magnificence, so you'll always have a chance to admire the landscapes, secrets and clearing out the game areas without any abrupt shifts or pauses (unlike Hob, just to give you an example).

TO SUM UP:

Play this game if you want to be enchanted by a gorgeous, expensive and short puzzle - story driven game. If you're looking for a long puzzle game only, you might have to look for something else.

Thanks for reading and for bearing up with me, leave a comment below if you have any questions or observations, have an amazing day/night.

39388718.review:
I was really looking forward to this game. It looked gorgeous and relaxing - just the type of game I love to play. Unfortunately, I was a bit disappointed.

Pros:
-Absolutely stunning.
-The soundtrack is fantastic.
-Puzzles aren't too difficult (definitely don't overthink them or you will get stuck).
-Super interesting visuals and ideas.

Meh
-The story is simple but you don't really understand much until the very end. Once the ending was revealed, a lot of the gameplay mechanics and symbolism really made sense, but I would have liked to have understood a bit more as I went through the game. Going OH repeatedly at the end of the game took away from the story. This is the type of game you need to replay to get the full value of the story/symbolism.
-Controller controls are a bit meh.
-Maneuvering the boy can get a little annoying - you have to hit some things just right or you have to start all over.
-The game is essentially a jumping/parkour simulator. This isn't necessarily a bad thing, but it is not what I wanted out of a game, so I got super bored quickly. Especially when I kept missing jumps and had to start all over.

Cons
-The camera is horrible. It locks in certain areas, making it impossible to look around and see where you need to go. Other times it positions itself weirdly and the angles make it seem like you're closer to something than you really are, resulting in missed jumps.
-Sometimes it is really hard to figure out where you need to go/what you need to do. The level layout is a bit wonky. It allows for a lot of exploration if you're into that kind of thing, but it can become a maze-like convoluted mess to those who just want to run through the game.

I really, really, really wanted to adore this game. And in some respects I do. It is stunningly beautiful. The soundtrack really adds to the atmosphere. The story is emotional and interesting. Yet, at the same time, the game is boring. The first chapter consists of running around 'collecting' a few things. The second chapter consists of running from spot to spot while being chased. The third chapter is by far the absolute best - the puzzles are great, the gameplay mechanics are wonderful, and the story bits are fantastic. Then the fourth chapter is basically a repeat of the first chapter but with rain. I think, overall, I was just disappointed that the game wasn't what I expected. I wanted a super compelling story game with puzzle mechanics. Instead I got a jumping simulator with a story that doesn't really make sense until the very end. Nothing that continuously compelled me to continue playing.

A playthrough of just the story will take you about 5 hours. Collecting all the things and achievements might take you around 10 hours. You will likely be super bored. I still recommend the game but definitely get it on sale. $30 is too much.

39370012.review:
RiME had a very troubled development. The Spanish team Tequila Works, known for Deadlight (2012), began working on it in 2010 with the temporary title of Echoes of Siren; it should have been an action RPG with isometric view, crafting and survival mechanics, building of fortifications, strategic battles, exploration. Microsoft initially supported the project but later rejected it; the ball passed into the hands of Sony, which made it an exclusive for Playstation, until in 2016 Tequila Works repurchased the rights to distribute it on all platforms. Meanwhile, the concept of the game was completely transformed; the title became RiME, which I think it’s for Rest in MEmory and alludes to the meaning of the whole adventure that I leave you to unveil: this review is spoiler free.

It is a third-person 3D adventure characterized by a pleasant cartoon-style cell shading graphics; it is set on a mysterious and fascinating island that offers a great variety of breathtaking scenery. You impersonate a child with a red cape that is shipwrecked on the island and wakes up on the seashore; the starting scene is reminiscent of the final scene of ICO, one of RiME’s inspirational sources; other sources of inspiration are certainly The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker (2002), Journey (2012) and The Last Guardian (2016). From the beginning you are captured by the magical atmosphere of the island, and stimulated to thoroughly explore it for understanding its many mysteries. Sceneries offer majestic architectures that remind of the ones of ICO and The Last Guardian and therefore refer to the metaphysical paintings of Giorgio De Chirico and in part also to some visions of Salvator Dali. A certain spiritual, mystical, and ancestral aura is strengthened by the rapid cycling of day and night, with effects of light and color enchanting eyes and spirit. If you have a romantic and sensitive soul, I advise you to play immersed in the quiet of the night to get the maximum enjoyment.

Main components of gameplay are initially exploration and contemplation; later on, environmental puzzles prevail. Puzzles make use of the alienating architectural perspectives and of light and shadow effects; they are well-designed and help to keep high the enigmatic and mystical atmosphere of the experience. Their locations are full of symbols that recall the unconscious, the past and the memory; they are not too difficult, do not require particular skills. Some of them are cooperative and have to be solved with the help of your companions; yes, you are not alone on the island: a little fox will be your guide spirit, and a strange automata, a sort of Wheatley from Portal 2 but bigger and on iron stilts, will lead you towards the end of your journey.

Gameplay will be sometime interrupted by enigmatic cut scenes concerning child’s past; they help to keep attention high and feed the desire to go on and understand the meaning of the experience. Aura of mystery is strengthened by frequent and suggestive encounters with a black and faceless man wrapped in a red cloth. Pace is well calibrated thanks to some moments of action where you have to face a few threats; in particular a big prehistoric bird that will give you a long hard time, and some strange hooded beings, a sort of dark priests who fear the light. Challenge is really minimal, and it is right for a game that focuses on contemplation; in any case you do not run the risk of dying: if you happen to fall from a ravine or get caught by the prehistoric bird or the dark priests, by magic you would start the game from the previous checkpoint, just a bit confused and bruised, just like in The Last Guardian.

And now we come to the less successful aspect of the game: narration.....

( for a deeper analisys and rating, continue on VGArt Website: https://vgartsite.wordpress.com/2018/01/15/rime/ )

Steam group: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/VgArtInt

Curator Page: http://store.steampowered.com/curator/26168615-Video-Games-Art-International/

39330481.review:
Ну, что я могу сказать об этой игре? Рыдала как последняя маленькая лодочка для эвакуации при кораблекрушении. Серьёзно. Человек я впечатлительный, ибо сначала пришла в восторг от саунда, красивых видов, ярких красок (видимо, чтобы мне прийти в восторг много не нужно) а потом всё сменилось озадаченностью и затем грустью. 
Сюжет, видимо, типичный для жанра бродилок - ходишь, ищешь, разгадываешь и постигаешь какую-то историю. Играем мы за посона попавшего на чудный остров после шторма. Остров этот напоминает своей скалистостью острова средиземноморья. Мы исследуем руины некогда богатого королевства архетиктура которого больше похожа на смесь греческой, инкской и майя. Вокруг бегает свинина, растут апельсины шикарных размеров, греет солнышко, птички летают...в общем красота. Саунд не раздражает а даже наоборот всячески соответствует происходящему в игре. Мелодично и в то же время грустно. 
Единственное что меня заставило проораться - это камера и управление. Камера жутко вымораживала когда переходила из режима третьего лица в какой-то статичный режим и посана нужно было направлять бежать уже по-другому. Само управление порой не доставляло: не хочет прыгать с первой команды, лезть куда-то куда нужно и т.д.

В общем, игру советую всем. Тащем-то помедитировать, задуматься, поплакать - самое то.

39500281.review:
Giving this a very weak recommendation.

It's a very pretty game and you can tell the developers really put a lot into it.  It's another "mysterious boy wakes up and must run through the world solving puzzles in order to contine proceeding through the world" games.  Its okay...it's fun in some parts, over-long in others.  I didn't hate it, but I didn't love it either.  By the end, I was wondering when it was going to end since it started to drag on and on. 

So here's the biggest issue...It wants to be Ico, but the problem is, the character you play is so generic.  In Ico, the boy stumbles around in a way that gives him character.  He has a girl to interact with and you get to care about him because he has personality in his body language and the way he interacts with her.  In Rime, you're just some kid who shouts at things a lot.  There's no emotion, and even when there is a part where he is crying, it still doesn't come off very realistic...now we just have a generic character who is crying.  Even worse is the lovely score hits you over the head literally trying to violently pull some feelings out of you, but it feels so cloying, it just comes off as "meh."

The end, well, I get it...and it was probably the only part that gave me a few goosebumps, but it's a little too Deus Ex Machina for me.  It's lazy.  I'd rather have a game like The Witness not even pretend to have a story but be somewhat entertaining, then the ending here that felt a little too tacked on.  Like they got to the end and went, "Oh, we really do need to find some time to make up a reason why the player is doing all these things..."

Anyways, I recommend it because it is pretty, has a nice soundtrack and it's a pleasant way to spend a couple of evenings.  Just don't expect to remember it for long when you're done.

39606636.review:
RiME，一眼望去有点Journey+塞尔达荒野之息的感觉，非拟真的画风，开放世界探索，以及开头模糊的世界观。较大的区别大约在于没有战斗，以及[strike]主角一开始就穿好了衣服[/strike]。有了这些标签，本作的属性也很明显了：开放世界的探索性，动作与解密的操作性，杰出动听的音乐，外加……糟糕的优化。

本作的探索解谜难度不算高，几乎不会因谜题卡关。题目没有特别惊世骇俗的创新之处，食物吸引，声控，视觉偏差等已经见惯不惊。全程无语言文字是一个亮点，不过游戏中很好地设置了指引和「标杆题目」，不会出现道具不知该怎么用的情况。RiME同时还提供了多套搜集要素，集全的话对于理解游戏的故事背景和世界观大有帮助，没有的话也不影响最后通关时理解剧情。如果完全不在意搜集的话，游戏流程倒是蛮直接的，二周目对着攻略补全落下的少许搜集物时，从头通关甚至不需要两个小时。

但是如果在意搜集要素的话，大范围跑动搜刮时会抱怨主角这小短腿跑步太慢，还时不时撞墙带来手柄一阵剧烈颤抖。与解谜相类似，物品的搜集方面也没有特别烧脑解题困难之处，大多属于你顺路留意到「这里有个缝」「那儿可以爬」「这是个可疑的死胡同」等。于是，如果稍微一走神，就错过了，而且多数没法回头，只能等通关后再单独选取五章之一进行补完，游戏时长10+小时大多拜其所赐。由于隐藏要素在「地点」，游戏中自然就有了一批设置得实在丧心病狂的物品，比如[spoiler]循环场景那俩碎片[/spoiler]，虽然有规律，但不看攻略直接发现这个的我还是蛮佩服的……

至于优化方面，尽管看起来不似发售时段评论中的那般惨烈，但风扇呼呼呼响是避免不了了。此外顿卡依然存在，不过本作对时机的容错性比较高所以还好。崩溃倒只出现了两次，所以还算幸运？不过看报道本作的Switch版还是掉帧异常惨烈且移植外包方表示完全不知所措，这只能说加油吧。

最后是剧情方面，RiME从头到尾握住了讲故事的节奏，保持了足够的耐心和克制，配上绝佳的BGM引导着玩家的情绪，没有出现浮躁的「故事的坑填不住」的烂尾，这个对于小制作的开放式解谜游戏来说殊为难得。游戏的世界观维持了相当一段的隐晦。游戏中我会对陆续出现的各种超自然的能力好奇，引路而追不上的红衣长者，狐狸，歌声，透视镜，[spoiler]一个能操纵时间的红衣男孩[/spoiler]，它们都代表着什么？而随着搜集到玩具和锁孔，其中透出来的信息碎片让我还是怀疑是[spoiler]王子归城复仇记[/spoiler]。[spoiler]而最后三四间章摧毁了之前的假设[/spoiler]，直到最后一章一切豁然开朗。应该来说虽然有反转，但是[spoiler]没有达到很强烈的冲击[/spoiler]。对于这个故事的结尾，反而应该和男主一样，缓缓而平静地接受了这一切。Let it go。

总体评价：B+
推荐指数：A

+ 优美的简式画风，动听的空灵音乐
+ 无文字语言下很好的教学指导，游戏过程流畅
+ 节奏把控良好的精心安排的世界观与剧情

- 优化捉急，实际需求配置远高于标定，请酌情降低特效
- 缺乏非常精妙的解谜，关卡较为流程化

推荐玩家：开放式休闲解谜玩家，BGM爱好者，高配置机器玩家，[strike]操控时间的红衣男孩爱好者[/strike]

40934550.review:
Just beat the game. I was not ready for that ending. By the time the credits rolled everything sort of blended together to give the full picture of what was happening. I loved this game. I don't have a single bad thing to say about it.

The story was pretty gripping, the characters were all very emotive as you knew what they were feeling without them having to say a word, and  the mechanics were pretty unique. I bought this game a while ago placed it on the backlog. Had I played this the year it came out I'd be screaming GOTY CONTENDER.

Anyway if you liked games like 'The Witness' or 'The Talos Principle', this game is right up your alley although I didn't find the puzzles to be as mind-numbingly difficult.

The pace of the game for me personally was perfect. I walk up to a puzzle, don't understand it one bit. After some pondering and playtesting with the physics/mechanics the eureka moment hits and it all makes sense. I never felt like pulling my hair out.

If you like an immersive, well paced story, progressively harder puzzles with different mechanics for most, and an eye for the art style (It only gets more beautiful) GET THIS GAME :D

40923985.review:
This game is a hidden gem in the gaming world. Gorgous graphics, amazing storyline, and great gameplay. The game is one of very few on steam that I absolutly love that has no violence in it whatsoever. While some darker areas on the map may scare small children, and certain mobs as well, overall it is a very great game I could recommend to anyone looking for something to sink their money into. However, without spoiling the game I will say this, the objects and objectives in the game are highly symbolic. I recommend AFTER completing the game to go look for a simpler explanation online as the game, espeacially the ending, is not very obvious in its meanings. This is also a very puzzle and story centric game, keep that in mind before purchasing if your looking for something faster paced, as this game is generally very slow, and mostly aims to invoke different emotions in the player.

As for the cons, there aren't very many. They are on the development side, but here they are in order from greatest complaints to least:

For one, Anti-Aliasing in this game is broken. I am running a Vega 56 card overclocked and I COULD NOT run SSAA even in 1080p medium settings. I was getting 20fps tops with horrible input lag. TXAA also has issues barley letting me hold on to 40-50 fps with some massive frame rate spikes dipping into the 20s. Honestly however, FXAA looks fine and seems to work great in this game. I was able to hold 60fps (as the max allowed in this game is 60fps for some reason) at 2k resolution max settings with FXAA on. I really wish the developers would fix this, but since this game is ported from console I can see why they would have issues like this.

Second, the parkour mechanics (at least on PC) can be frustrating at times. The main character you play has issues grabbing onto ledges you are supposed to climb or jump onto if you are already on another platform. Even if the distance is small and it is obvious that is where you need to go next. To make your life easier here is a TIP: While climbing be sure that your character is reaching out for the next platform BEFORE your make any jumps, this will tell you if he will make the jump or not without uneccesarily falling to his death.

Third, even without VSYNC, Freesync, Gsync, or whatever else you have, 60FPS is the max allowed in this game, I don't see why but that is just the way it is. Mabey it's for the physics engine or something but I doubt it. You really don't need more then 60fps in this game but I thought I would mention it.

Fourth: By far the most minor complaint, but it shows a small lack of polish with the port of this game to PC. MINOR SPOILER AHEAD!!!!!!!!!....... With that being said in certain spots in the game where you have to run from a mob (like in the above game pictures and preview section where you are running away from the bird) you character does not run straight across the bridge because of the camera angle. Because of this it is way to easy to fall off the bridge while running for your life. Its easy to fix this by just tapping the direction you need to go to compensate for the slight drag you have while trying to go straight but it needed to be mentioned so a dev can fix this small issue in an otherwise amazing game.

Overall: This game recieves 8/10 for what it is, and only loses the 2 points due to some issues with the port to PC. Keep in mind, I am a harsh critique. With that said, if you are on the fence, BUY THIS GAME!

40905540.review:
Rime è un gioco che nei suoi mood e paesaggi, ma specialmente nella sua poesia ricorda moltissimo Journey. Ma la storia che si dipana davanti al giocatore via via che prosegue e colleziona i giocattoli, gli emblemi e le serrature nascoste nei vari mondi, è molto diversa. 
La soundtrack è qualcosa di veramente pazzesco e la voce sarà un elemento importantissimo tanto nei puzzle quanto come elemento ricorrente nella storia. 
Se volete una vera sfida per quanto riguarda i puzzle, beh questo forse non è il gioco per voi, ma se siete collezionisti incalliti, vi darà spesso filo da torcere.

RiME è un gioiellino, consigliatissimo per chiunque voglia immergersi in una storia diversa dalle altre, come anche i nomi dei mondi suggeriscono. Era da parecchio che non mi emozionavo così e in mio parere merita un acquisto full price.
Davvero complimenti ai ragazzi della Tequila Softworks per questo piccolo pezzo di poesia videoludica.
Non darò ulteriori informazioni, quindi eccovi i miei pro, contro e voto finale.

PRO 
+ Atmosfere magiche e fantastiche, leggermente malinconiche riuscitissime
+ Soundtrack veramente emozionante
+ Personaggi credibili e storia eccelsamente raccontata 
+ Numerosi (ma non troppi) collezionabili, spesso nascosti in maniera veramente malvagia ma intelligente.
+ Possibilità (una volta finito) di rivivere i capitoli per collezionare tutti i trofei
+ Camera fluida, che potenzia i momenti topici lungo la storia e segue bene il personaggio
+ Level design interessante e quasi mai ripetitivo

CONTRO
- Sarebbe stato meglio, a gioco finito, permettere al giocatore di rivivere determinati momenti all'interno del capitolo, piuttosto che farlo ricominciare dal principio dello stesso
- Quando la camera si sposta, così fanno anche i comandi, quindi se si percorre un ponte ad esempio, e la camera si sposta per motivi cinematografci, il nostro personaggio andrà in diagonale piuttosto che orizzontale
- A volte è tedioso rivistare luoghi o tornare sui propri passi per la relativa lentezza del personaggio 
- Avrei inserito all'interno del gioco qualcosa per far capire al giocatore che dopo quel determinato punto, non sarebbe stato più possibile tornare indietro

VOTO: 8/10

40884661.review:
Einfach perfekt.

Es kommt selten vor, dass ich ein Produkt als "perfekt" bewerten würde, aber RiME hat es aus meiner Sicht verdient:
Das Spiel bietet ca. zwei Tage lang ein spannendes Abenteuer, das nahezu gewaltfrei und damit auch für Kinder ab ca. 10 Jahren empfohlen ist. Aufgrund teilweise düsterer Passagen halte ich es für kleinere Kinder eher ungeeignet. (Die können z.B. "Seasons after Fall" spielen.) Kann der Protagonist, ein schiffbrüchiger Junge, im ersten Kapitel noch eine idyllische Insel recht ungezwungen und in Ruhe erkunden, so sind die späteren Level deutlich linearer aufgebaut, und es gilt stellenweise auch, Gefahren aus dem Weg zu gehen. Ein süßer Fuchs leitet einen durch den Großteil der Geschichte, aber wer nur ihm folgt, übersieht manch versteckte Wege...
Unterwegs kann der Junge durch Schlüssellöcher Fragmente einer (seiner?) Geschichte erfahren, aber ich finde, erst am Spielende erschließt sich älteren Spielern der tiefere Sinn.

Die Grafik ist, wie man Trailer und Screenshots entnehmen kann, zwar cartoonhaft, aber die Szenerien im Wechsel der Tageszeiten trotzdem so stimmungsvoll, dass ich als Hobbyfotograf häufig von der "digitalen Kamera" (Screenshot-Taste) Gebrauch gemacht habe, und sei es nur zum Einfangen eines kitschigen Sonnenuntergangs mit Ruinen. Über 500 Fotos und "Selfies" sind so entstanden. Immer wieder gibt es Räume oder Orte, da fiel mir so richtig die Kinnlade runter! Auch die eingestreuten animierten Sequenzen fügen sich nahtlos in das Spiel ein.

Neben der Grafik kann das Spiel zudem noch mit einem tollen Soundtrack punkten (im Handel erhältlich), und auch das Gameplay fand ich gut. Die von mir gespielte Version 1.0.4 ist nie abgestürzt und hatte keine nennenswerten Fehler. Auch das ein Pluspunkt. Es gibt kein "Game Over" und keine Sackgassen, aus denen man nur durch Levelneustart wieder herauskommt - stattdessen werden Fehler (etwa Fehlsprünge) verziehen und man bekommt schlicht eine neue Chance. Selten kommte es auf exakte Präzision oder Timing an. Das macht das Spiel auch recht frustarm. Die Puzzle sind selten schwer, und das Spiel lässt einen meist auch eindeutig wissen, was funktionieren soll und was nicht. Wer allerdings auf die Suche nach den ganzen Sammelobjekten geht, wird gute Augen benötigen. Manche sind leichter, andere schwieriger zu finden oder zu erreichen.

Wenn es etwas zu kritisieren gibt, dann ist das wohl die Armkraft des vielleicht 12-jährigen Protagonisten, die Profi-Freikletterer neidisch machen würde. Na ja, künstlerischer Freiheit halt. Höhenangst hat er offenbar auch keine. ;-)

Wer sich ärgert, dass das Spiel nach vielleicht zwei Tagen schon vorbei ist, kann sich noch an die Suche nach (bzw. die Herausforderung von) den restlichen Errungenschaften machen ... irgendwas gibt es garantiert noch zu entdecken.

40674019.review:
RiME was a mixed bag for me. I was very excited about this game because of how beautiful it looked. But in the end, I have mixed feelings:

+ beautiful graphics: water, rocks, metal and other textures are all breathtaking. The color palette is also perfect.
+ ‎nice soundtrack
+ ‎not super long
+ ‎can be fun to play: climbing, swimming, exploration and puzzle solving

- framerate drops in certain areas even with specs above the recommended
- ‎few characters and no dialogue AT ALL. I personally prefer games with different characters, dialogues and interactions
- ‎puzzles were mostly too simple and repetitive. A lot of the time, I wouldn't even call them "puzzles". It's more like acting a script in a movie because you just go and do the obvious. Only a couple of them were fun for me.
- ‎I found the ghost-like figures too creepy
- ‎a map would have been very welcome, I felt lost a lot of the time after stage 1.
- ‎no manual save points... Sometimes you just can't keep playing anymore and you wish you could just save and leave it there.
- ‎my biggest complain: the story, the "adventure". First, it's way too vague for me. I hate stories were you have very little concrete information and are left wondering and theorising, absolutely hate them. I didn't expect this game to be like this and it totally is. Also, the story itself... Spoilers ahead: I was totally disappointed to see that this island was somehow not actually real and the quest, the adventure I thought I was living, was totally not like what I had imagined. I thought this would be a great adventure were we would end up saving the island somehow, that we would have a victorius and happy ending. But it turned out to be a vaguely defined tragedy. I don't play video games to get depressed or confused while theorising. I play to go on a wonderful and exciting adventure that leaves me feeling satisfied and happy in the end. Think Zelda. The problem is that you advertise the game like it's this great magical adventure, like something super exciting, when it turns out to be a sad and tragical story, not very exciting at all. You should hint at this in your description so that people like me don't end up disappointed.

I really loved the visuals though. Props, thanks for that.

40625055.review:
RiME is a 3rd person exploration platformer, and graphically a feast for eyes - such vibrant colours, beautiful stylized environment, lots of stunning vistas, changing night/day cycle. Top notch aesthetics! There are few locations visually quite distinct from one another. And while I did prefer chapters 1 & 3 for their brighter palette, all of them painted a really nice atmosphere. 

The game features some puzzles too, but if you're following the main route, they are all quite easy and fairly obvious to figure out what needs to be done. The difficulty raises only if you decide to go for all the collectibles - many of them are tricky to obtain & hard to spot. Although there are way too many sets of objects to collect that don't serve any other purpose than collecting for the sake of collecting. Only few types were useful, like outfits, lullaby song parts (such a beautiful tune btw), or metaphorical story panels. But I can stand behind making the difficulty dynamic depending on how the player chooses to play :)

The story was vague and enigmatic most of the time, but when the reveal came at the end it turned out to be very emotional. I quite enjoyed the game overall. Personally, I do like exploring breathtaking & well crafted surroundings in a non-verbal setting, but I recognize that might not be enough for everyone.

[i]Written after completing the game with 9.5 hours played & 31 of 31 (100%) achievements earned.[/i]

40562048.review:
Il est des jeux qui vous mettent une claque et d'autres qui vous font l'effet d'une caresse. [i][b]RiME[/b][/i] n'est pas vraiment du nombre. Ou, plutôt, il est des deux mondes à la fois. Du genre à... disons, à vous [i]asséner[/i] une caresse. Une [i]careque[/i], en somme. Ça commence comme une caresse et se termine comme une claque.

La caresse, elle, vient de ce qu'il est beau. Pas d'une beauté superficielle, qui s'imagine que, pour plaire ou susciter le désir, il faut à tout prix se couvrir de fard. Un fard qui masquerait d'ailleurs l'essentiel, une manière de supercherie s'apparentant à un bel écrin vide. Non, [i][b]RiME[/b][/i] est d'une beauté simple, authentique, sans fioriture. Une beauté touchante. Une beauté à qui vide et silence ne font pas peur, une beauté que ne dégrade en rien quelques menus défauts. Une beauté libre, sincère, au sens où ce qu'elle montre est le reflet fidèle de ce qu'elle recèle. Une beauté qui ne craint pas que coule son maquillage, sous quelque déluge de pluie. Après tout, elle n'en porte aucun.

Seulement, la caresse finit tôt ou tard par se muer en claque. Oui, tôt ou tard, selon votre degré de perspicacité. Me concernant, ce fut tardif au possible. Peut-être parce qu'il m'a d'une certaine manière subjugué, de sorte que je suis passé à côté des indices qu'il avait pourtant semés sur ma route. Ou peut-être parce que, depuis toujours, en particulier en matière de jeu vidéo et de littérature, j'aime à me laisser surprendre. C'est plus fort que moi, que voulez-vous, j'incline par-dessus tout à fermer les yeux sur ce qui les crève, pour mieux reconstituer le fil de l'intrigue a posteriori. Mais ne vous méprenez pas ! la gifle en question ne résulte aucunement d'un vice caché ou de défauts qui prendraient le pas sur ses qualités. Non, cette gifle-là émane en réalité d'une prise de conscience aussi poignante qu'amère : sur le charmant visage de cette beauté simple, la pluie se mêle aux larmes.

Vous me permettrez de taire les détails, sous peine de vous gâcher la découverte. Pour me faire pardonner, je pourrais vous décrire la chose par le menu, avec des considérations d'ordre technique, dont certaines confinent au pinaillage. Des considérations du style "[i]chargements longs, mais très rares[/i]", "[i]parkour pour ainsi dire téléphoné[/i]", "[i]quelques chutes de framerate[/i]", "[i]impression de liberté appréciable, qui cache en fait une aventure linéaire[/i]", "[i]narration muette, assez nébuleuse, reposant pour partie sur des collectibles très - trop ! - bien dissimulés[/i]", "[i]énigmes nombreuses, variées, très bien conçues[/i]" ou "[i]ambiance, notamment sonore, et direction artistique en général de haute volée[/i]". Honnêtement, l'envie me manque d'autant plus qu'une analyse chirurgicale de cette beauté-là ne lui rendrait pas hommage.

Et puis, pour sa défense, l'aspect [i]parkour[/i] est secondaire. Il ne constitue pas le coeur du jeu, très loin de là : une vétille, donc. Vous noterez du reste que ce qualificatif ne figure pas parmi les tags du jeu ; à juste titre. Tout dépend sans doute des raisons qui vous auront poussé vers [i][b]RiME[/b][/i], mais sachez une chose : si le [i]parkour[/i] en fait partie, vous n'êtes assurément pas au bon endroit !

Enfin, j'ajouterais que vous incombe la responsabilité de rendre cette expérience non linéaire, tout comme il vous appartient d'élucider les grandes lignes de son histoire, autant que faire se peut. Vous vous devez de ne pas la parcourir en ligne droite. Vous vous devez de vous écarter des sentiers battus. Sans quoi cela reviendrait à juger de sa beauté sans lui avoir accordé le regard qu'elle mérite.

[u]EDIT[/u] : Est-il nécessaire de préciser que [i][b]RiME[/b][/i] compte, au nombre de ses influences, l'oeuvre d'un certain [b]Fumito Ueda[/b] ?

[h1]Verdict : 5/5 - Le sans-faute, à acheter les yeux fermés ! Et à jouer les yeux grand ouverts.[/h1]

40330527.review:
Prima volta che scrivo una recensione, ma questo gioco la merita davvero.

Apparso come un fulmine a ciel sereno mentre guardavo il mio pannello di Nvidia, mi sono approcciato a questo gioco che avevo fugacemente visto un paio di volte tra le notizie, lasciandomi catturare dalle sue peculairità in poco tempo.

Ci troviamo a vestire i panni di un bambino, apparentemente naufragato su un isola tropicale, che deve riuscire a ritrovare un modo per tornare a casa superando i vari enigmi dell'isola, mentre una figura rossa incappucciata lo osserva sempre da lontano...

La prima cosa che mi ha colpito è stato l'impatto visivo.
Il design cartoonesco e i colori vividi sono elementi che saltano subito all'occhio del giocatore, risultando facilmente apprezzabili.
Questi elementi sono poi messi in ulteriore risalto dal level design delle varie zone, il quale oltre che nella struttura varierà anche nella palette di colori utilizzata, facendo trasparire da parte dell'autore una forte ispirazione artistica.

Questi e anche altri elementi (come la totale assenza di dialoghi in game o la bassa e calcolata presenza di nemici nel gioco) fanno percepire mentre si gioca una certa vicinanza ai titoli di Fumito Ueda come Ico, Shadow of the Colossus o The Last Guardian, e infatti anche questa è una storia che si racconta in silenzio, senza Npc simili a noi con cui interagire o parlare, con dettagli nascosti pensati apposta per coloro che sanno/vogliono osservare... 

...ma non per questo preclusa per coloro che vogliono vivere un esperienza, ossia il viaggio questo bambino attraverso questo strano luogo, fino al commovente finale.

40249563.review:
《rime》9/10
整部游戏的建筑风格美到令人窒息，可以看出来取景自爱琴海小镇与希腊风情，同时还有埃及的影子。解谜可以用简单二字形容，不能说简单好或不好，因为画面和配乐做的很赞足以弥补没什么存在感的解谜，画面独特和优美，偏卡通风格的3D，却看上去如此的自然和成熟。动听的BGM：BGM大多是小提琴、大提琴与钢琴的相互搭配，有很多不同的调子，可以听出来制作组在音乐这方面也下了不少功夫，接近尾声和结局多处激昂并且搭配感人剧情的配乐更是令本作再次升华了一个层次。

老少皆宜的艺术品游戏，除了欲言又止的剧情小孩子可能看不懂，从头到尾没有一句对白与旁白，却讲述了一个悲伤的故事:[h1]以下介绍含剧透：[/h1][spoiler]本游戏讲述了一名父亲大意在一次航海过程中失去了他的儿子，他的儿子不能接受自己死亡的事实一路寻找归属，然后和还活着的父亲紧紧相拥，最后化为乌有。玩家最后会控制他的父亲松开手上的红色披风让它飘向远方，相信也是松开他们父子彼此一直摇摇欲坠的、沉重的心。把握当下吧， 明天和意外，你永远不知道哪个会先来。[/spoiler]剧情蛮感人的，但是没玩到后面可能会一头雾水，如果看不懂剧情耐心玩下去就好，总比那些从头到尾都让人一头雾水的游戏要好。

《The Song of the Sea》

Llorando/哭泣着[/i]

rime讲了一个关于失去关于释怀的故事，告别了狐狸球球的温暖，小男孩才能继续走下去，放下对孩子的执念，爸爸才能重新开始生活。当红斗篷消逝在风里时忍不住泪目，这个世上有太多太多的无能为力，我们能做的只有释怀与放下，然而仅仅是释怀，已经是太难太难的事了——网易云热评

[code]亮点：
+独特的画面风格
+有内涵的剧情
+清新的配乐
+解谜简单

不足：
-解谜简单
-优化不太友好 
-收集元素有点鸡肋[/code]

总评：艺术品游戏，解谜元素还可以做到更好。

40006732.review:
В [b]Rime[/b] довольно просто и очень приятно играть, но лично мне поначалу непросто было смириться с печальной судьбой гг, даже после повторного прохождения и получения альтернативной концовки.
Что ж, геймплей тут незатейливый и основан на исследовании локаций и решении на них простых задачек. Помимо простого линейного прохождения на локациях есть некоторые хитро спрятанные (не обязательные) секреты, которые придётся постараться найти. В целом играется ненапряжно, и даже испытываешь некий расслабляющий эффект благодаря атмосферным и красивым пейзажам, а также отличному звуку и превосходной музыке (by [url=http://music.greybox.com/releases]David García Díaz[/url]).
Ну а простая с виду история раскрывается в пяти отдельных главах [spoiler](5-ти стадиях принятия неизбежного)[/spoiler], преодолев которые вам ничего не останется, как смириться с истиной.
Единственный недостаток в игре - это не доведённая до ума оптимизация на высоких параметрах: в некоторых локациях реально заметны проседания фпс. Благо настройки гибкие и отзывчивые, поэтому это легко решаемо снижением уровней сглаживания и фильтрации.

39992739.review:
First and foremost, this is an exploration game, I'd say one step up from a walking simulator. 
It isn't fully open world, but there's plenty of opportunities to veer off the beaten path to find collectibles and see the sights.

The puzzles are mostly simple, only a few take a moment to ponder. 
The game is visually stunning and the animations are beautiful. The game is a work of art.
The soundtrack is simply brilliant and really engaging.
The game is an emotional rollercoaster. When you realise what's happening it will shock you.
Another game that tells a great story without saying a word!

If you like: Abzu, Brothers, The Vanishing of Ethan Carter etc. Then you'll love this.

Nitpicking: 
The chapter select feature could have more load points for those hunting collectibles.

39992540.review: Awesome game! Puzzles are just challenging enough so you don't lose focus on the storytelling.

39984864.review:
Rime is definitely one of the best games I've played in the last few years.

The gameplay itself is very interesting and engaging. I loved the imagination that went in this game. 

As for the story, I wouldn't like to spoil anything so I'll just say that it is perfect for an Indie game and also very beatifully approached.

All in all a great game that will provide very good quality entertainment for all audiences. I definitely recommend it to everyone.

[h1][i] [b]                        RiME [/b][/i]（推荐）                  [/h1]
    [b]这是一个独立游戏，好几年前就看到过它的概念图，当时就想着一定要买这款游戏。一开始我是抱着和玩[i]ABZU[/i]一样的心态去玩这个游戏，但是玩着玩着就发现，这是一个意识流的游戏。[/b]

39867506.review:
Un Journey un peu bas de gamme. Ne vous méprenez pas, ce jeu est très beau tant sur la patte graphique (ce qui m'a poussé à l'acquérir) et la musique. Seulement, le tout reste un peu terne. 

L'histoire n'est pas aussi prenante qu'il n'y paraît, je suis resté hermétique au côté rêveur et émerveillement qui transpire des trailers et images. On ne réfléchit pas plus de trente secondes pour résoudre les "puzzles", l'exploration est gâchée par un personnage lent ainsi qu'un univers vide ... Bref, aucune attache sentimentale pour ma part alors que c'est clairement le premier but des développeurs. 

Si, comme moi, vous êtes attachés à l'exploration, le storytelling, la poésie vidéoludique et vous évader profondément dans des univers oniriques: passez votre chemin de risque de vous ennuyer. Finir le jeu était plus une corvée qu'une envie d'en découvrir plus.

39845164.review:
Dość często słyszałem o klasykach na PS2 takich jak: Shadow of the Colossus czy Ico. Opinie były różne, lecz w każdej z nich podkreślana była wyjątkowość tych produkcji. W końcu nadarzyła się okazja do zagrania w tytuł nawiązujący do wyżej wymienionych gier.
 
Jakby tu zacząć? Może jak zawsze od początku! RiME zostało wydane przez Grey Box, za co im serdecznie dziękuję. Początkowa gra ta miała być ekskluziwem na PS4. Sony na szczęście się rozmyśliło i zmieniono wydawcę, dzięki czemu mogłem zagrać na PC. Jest to moje drugie podejście do gry i powiem, że zrobiło na mnie..., ale o tym później.

Fabuła gry jest dość oszczędna i do tego wydzielana dość skąpo, co traktuję na plus, bo pozwalało to interpretować czy też domyślać się o co w niej chodzi. Na początku  dowiadujemy się, że kierujemy chłopcem na oko 10-letnim. No, i że jest rozbitkiem, bo cała historia rozpoczyna się na plaży, gdzie zostaje on wyrzucony przez morze. Teraz wypada nakreślić jaki cel będzie nam przyświecać. No właśnie... żaden.

 Idziemy przed siebie, gdzie nas nogi poniosą. Brzmi to trochę jak żart, lecz tak jest. Generalnie gra jest o stracie, pogodzeniu się z losem i akceptacji bądź nie, tego co życie ze sobą niesie. Uprzedzam jedynie, że jest to dramat, który może wycisnąć łzy, choć mniej wrażliwi mogą machnąć na to ręką. Wszystko zależy od tego czy wczujecie się w grę.

Po pełną recenzje zapraszam na mojego bloga:
www.adziszagramw.blogspot.com/2018/01/recenzja-rime.html

39714889.review:
This game has stunning visual design, a subtle (and emotionally impactful) story and fun (but not particularly difficult) puzzles.

The design of the world is beautiful, but in terms of render quality it's not really close to the top new games. The camera behaviour is also a bit irritating at times (although certainly not the worst I've seen).

I found the puzzles engaging but not particularly hard (once I'd worked out the mechanics of a new puzzle piece). If you are primarily interested in challenging logic puzzles, there are other games that will do that better. This is a more relaxed style of puzzle.

The story is not handed to you on a plate, and it's not clear what's going on until the end (and even then, there's a reasonable amount left to the player's interpretation). The ending packed a real emotional punch, though, and a lot of that comes from the subtle build up.

To get the most out of it, I would recommend avoiding anything that might be spoilery, and taking the time to explore the world as you go.
